descriptionSet.description: On this lobby card for the Hindi movie "Dream Girl" from 1977, two of the main actors, probably Dharmendra and Hema Malini, are depicted. He, wearing a greay suite, is standing behind her and has his left arm around her shoulder. She, wearing a blue dress, touches with both hands the hand of his left arm. In the background, a red curtain as well as a golden luster can be seen. On the left upper secton of the image, the logo of Sarathy International is pictured as well as the logo of Trimurti Films on the lower right section.

inscription.text: Sarothy International's Gulshan Rai presents Dream Girl Directed by Pramod Chakravorty Produced by I.K. Bahl & Jaya Chakravarthy Music Laxmikant Pyarelal Lyrics Anand Bakshi Trimurti Films World Rights

location.name: Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art
Delhi / The Priya Paul Collection of Popular Art

hra:item.hra:value: text-en: Sarothy International's Gulshan Rai presents Dream Girl Directed by Pramod Chakravorty Produced by I.K. Bahl & Jaya Chakravarthy Music Laxmikant Pyarelal Lyrics Anand Bakshi Trimurti Films World Rights

description-en: On this lobby card for the Hindi movie "Dream Girl" from 1977, two of the main actors, probably Dharmendra and Hema Malini, are depicted. He, wearing a greay suite, is standing behind her and has his left arm around her shoulder. She, wearing a blue dress, touches with both hands the hand of his left arm. In the background, a red curtain as well as a golden luster can be seen. On the left upper secton of the image, the logo of Sarathy International is pictured as well as the logo of Trimurti Films on the lower right section. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Story line of the movie: Sapna, who works under a number of aliases, is a modern day female Robin Hood, who steals from whoever she can, so that she can maintain a home for orphans. One day she meets with wealthy and eligible bachelor, Anupam Verma, and poses as a wealthy princess. He takes her to meet his grandparents, and even lets her live in his palatial bungalow. But soon Sapna's past catches up with her, when she is recognized as Champabai, a prostitute. (gs)
related hyperlinks: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0157556/, last accessed 2011-12-19, story line, director, leading actors. (gs)

explanatory comments/crosstagging: Strangely, there are the logos of two companies on that lobby card, Trimurti Films, one of the biggest South Asian movie production companies, as well as Sarathy International. (gs)
